text.text: How do I access the All Charge Details report?

text: To run the All Charge Details report, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. 2. Scroll down the list and click All charge details. 3. Accounting Period Start Date: Click this field and select the accounting period date. 4. Profit Centers: Click this field to select one or more profit centers to include in the report.

text.text: Can you explain the significance of selecting the accounting period start date?

text: The accounting period start date is used to select the accounting period for the report. The system ignores the data of all the previous periods after you set the starting period.

text.text: What options do I have for selecting profit centers in the report?

text: You can select one or more profit centers to include in the report. You can also include inactive profit center zones.

text.text: How can I include inactive profit center zones in the report?

text: To include inactive profit center zones in the report, you can select the True button.

text.text: Is there an option to display HCPCS codes in the report?

text: Yes, you can display HCPCS codes in the report by selecting the True button.

text.text: What information does the All Charge Details report contain?

text: The All Charge Details report contains the following information: Account and claim number, HCPCS code, quantity, and charge amount, Accounting period, Patient name, Billed date and billed by, Payer, Claim charge amount, Policy, Date of service, Profit center. You can also export the report to a .csv file.

text.text: How are the columns organized in the report?

text: The columns are organized as follows: Account and claim number, HCPCS code, quantity, and charge amount, Accounting period, Patient name, Billed date and billed by, Payer, Claim charge amount, Policy, Date of service, Profit center.

text.text: What is the significance of exporting the report to a .csv file?

text: Exporting the report to a .csv file allows you to view and manage the data. You can also use Excel to view and manage the data.

text.text: How can exporting the report benefit me in managing the data?

text: You can use Excel to view and manage the data.

text.text: Can you provide guidance on how to export the report to a .csv file?

text: To export the report to a .csv file, you can use Excel to view and manage the data.

text.text: Are there alternative formats available for exporting the report?

text: Exporting the report to a .csv file allows you to view and manage the data. You can also use Excel to view and manage the data.

text.text: How can I utilize the exported data for further analysis?

text: You can use Excel to splice and dice the report to find trends and claim that may fall out of line from the norm.

text.text: Are there any instructional resources available for understanding and utilizing the report effectively?

text: To learn how to use Excel, you can use the videos in the "Using Excel to Manipulate your Report Data".

text.text: Can you summarize the key insights that can be obtained from the All Charge Details report?

text: The All Charge Details report shows all charge details by claim or by HCPC code posted for all transactions. You can select your accounting period start date and profit center to see charges by profit center.

text.text: How can I run All Charge Details report?

text: To run the report, you can: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports 2. Scroll down the list and click All Charge Details 3. Accounting Period Start Date: Click this field and select the accounting period date 4. Profit Centers: Click this field to select one or more profit centers to include in the report 5. Display Inactive Zones: If you want to include inactive profit center zones, select True 6. Display HCPCS: If you want to include HCPCS, select True 7. Click View Report

text.text: What information can I know from All Charge Details report?

text: The All Charge Details report contains the following columns of information: Account and claim number, HCPCS code, quantity, and charge amount, Accounting period, Patient name, Billed date and billed by, Payer, Claim charge amount, Policy, Date of service, Profit center.

text.text: How to to digest the information in All Charge Details report?

text: One of the best way to digest the information in the report is to export the report to a .csv file. From there you can view/manage the data.
